meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm back with my latest review of the oh-so-sneaky Deceive Inc. game!

As a seasonal grok reviewer (yes, that's a thing!), I've got a knack for spotting the good stuff and poking fun at myself along the way. And let me tell you, this game has got some serious sneaking up on the competition (see what I did there?).

So, what did the other critics say? Well, PC Gamer gave it an 82, saying it's a "creative blend of sneaking and shooting that will have squads coming back for more." The Games Machine chimed in with an 80, praising Deceive Inc.'s stealth approach. And Shacknews and TheGamer both gave it a respectable 70, commending its unique visual and conceptual creativity.

But what about poor ol' GameSkinny, who gave it a paltry 60? Apparently, they're having some issues with the player base (not unlike my own struggles finding the perfect gaming chair).

As for me, I won't bother giving you a score – that's too easy. Instead, let's focus on the gameplay!

Deceive Inc. has got the makings of a top-notch multiplayer experience. With its sneaky-stealthy approach and fun, fast-paced action, it's an absolute blast to play (pun intended). And don't even get me started on the visuals – this game is like a cinematic spy thriller come to life!

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about those pesky bugs?" Ah, yes! Let me just whisper to you that the developers are working overtime to iron out those wrinkles.

All in all, Deceive Inc. is a real gem (or should I say, a real sneaky gem?) that's definitely worth your time and attention. Trust old Hippo Penny on this one!

Stay groovy, gamers!
